intro: Staphidium lanatum, commonly known as the woolly staphidium, is a species of flowering plant in the family Onagraceae. It is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and stems, which give it a distinctive, fuzzy appearance. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It is native to regions of South America, particularly in countries like Brazil and Argentina. Staphidium lanatum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along streambanks.
